thread.title: Bad driving days: Motorists having a worse day than you
thread.title_full: Bad driving days: Motorists having a worse day than you - Telegraph

author: Ali Gray
title: Bad driving days: Motorists having a worse day than you
text: Perhaps you spilled coffee on yourself during your commute. Or maybe you got stuck in a traffic jam and were late to a big meeting. Whatever driving disaster has got you down, you can rest assured that there are people out there who have it worse. Check out these driving fails – and get ready to feel better about your own problems. If you’re feeling bitter about the British winter, just be thankful you don’t live in Canada. Photo: Getty That low bridge warning should have been a bit more clear. Photo: Alamy This spot was a tight squeeze – even for a compact car. Photo: Rex When your fellow travellers don’t seem the least bit fussed about sticking to the itinerary... Photo: Getty We wouldn’t want to cross him in a dark alley. Photo: Alamy We’d hate to see what happens if you accidentally cut him off. Photo: Exposure Not the sort of roadside assistance he was looking for. Photo: Getty “I told you, Dave – just pretend we’re in a convertible.” Photo: Alamy That will teach him to blindly follow the sat nav. Photo: Rex We’re pretty sure that’s not what he had in mind when he asked for a new paint job. Photo: Rex Spend more time laughing and less time worrying behind the wheel. With the AA on your side, you're covered when the unpredictable happens. Find out more at theaa.com
